title: Question 14:  Why the calling with the number of the HSPA device is unavailable while using the HSPA data card as uplink?
answer:
(1) Observe the HSPA indicator is blue or not. If the LED is red, this indicates that the HSPA device hasn’t registered to the network correctly or needed to register with PIN number. Register with PIN number or wait for a moment until the HSPA device has registered into the network. Besides these, you could plug the HSPA device again in order to make the HSPA device registered again.
(2)Check the condition of the network is well or not. You could examine the signal of handset that is near to you or plug the HSPA device into PC for checking signal in the background.
(3) If the data card has registered to the 2G network meanwhile it is processing data service , we couldn’t calling from outside with the number of the HSPA device.
